name: Phenomenology
description: Phenomenology is a method used in the analysis of human awareness and subjectivity. It has been applied in the social sciences, in the humanities, and in philosophy. Texts studied are from Husserl and later practitioners, e.g., Heidegger, Sartre, Merleau-Ponty, Gurwitsch, and Ricoeur.
prerequisites: PHL210Y1/PHL217H1, 7.5 courses (in any field) with at least 1.5 in philosophy
